there used to be 6 departments until 1999, they were only assigned capitals in 2008

change in 2006 that I was unable to track. I think it went from 31 to 43

no change since 2002 (but there was a change in 1995. 15 departments became provinces and were divided into new departments. These provinces have 90 departments today, so I assume that there were 75 less departments in 1995)
New province in 2015 (rumonge). There was also another province that split in 2002
2004: one commune split into 9 and two additional communes were added (there was also one new commune created in 1997)

column5: The reform of the late 1980s subdivided the regions of Ghana into 110 districts, where local district assemblies should deal with the local administration. By 2006, an additional 28 districts were created by splitting some of the original 110, bringing their number up to 138. In February 2008, there were more districts created and some were upgraded to municipal status. This brought the final number to 170 districts in Ghana.Since then, a further 46 districts have been added since 28 June 2012 bringing the total to 216 districts.
the constitution changed in 2010. only then were counties created. There were districts before (which had changes)
one was created in 200 and one in 2001. no other changes since 1985
there were changes after 2006 but I couldn't find a good shapefile and the names of the headquarters. I think it went from 68 to 90
the regions were created in 22. before there were provinces which were abolished
4 new districts in 2007
3 districts were created in 1998 and one in 2003
2 new regions and 8 cercles were created in 2016. I am a bit unclear with the situation prior to 2002, would just use the Grossman info
There were 18 communes before 1996 when 684 additional ones were created. Unclear whether there are new communes post 2016
no change since 1984
1 new district in 2002, 23 in 2013 and 3 in 2016
the 13 regions were established in 1991 (from 26 districts), 1 more region in 2013
1992 established 95 constituencies, was increased to 102 in 1998, to 107 in 2002 and to 121 in 2013
no change since 1992 (but prior to 2001, they were called depatments)
In 2011, number of departments increases from 36 to 63. before that no change since 1992 (they were called arrondisment before 2001)
no change since 1996 (when it went from 31 to 36)
no change since 1999 when they were mentionned in the constitution. Unsure what was the situation before)
1 new region in 2002, 3 new regions in 2008, prior to that no change since 1984
changes in 2009 and 2012
no change since 1949, but two new districts in 2017
no change since independence, but in 2017 number was increased to 190
was reduced from 53 to 52 in 2005 and some boundaries were redrawn
changes in 2016
25 regions in ith 90s, one new one in 2003 and 4 new regions in 2012
19 new districts in 2012, sporadically new districts before that (see statoid)
new province in 2011, before that no change since 1973

in 2013 it went from 72 districts to 110 (but different sources speak of 103 or 106 districts after 2013). Unclear how long the 72 existed before statoids suggests that there were 57 in 1980 and 61 some time inbetween
2 new provinces in 1997 nothing since then or before that (since 1981)
some sources say there are 63, it depends how you count the urban districts. Some changes probably in 200 and 2001 but hard to keep track. There were 55 in 190
